author: Thanosvbest
title: The best Hogwarts set
review:
The lego Hogwarts astronomy tower is definitely the best lego Hogwarts expansion and here is why.

To start of with the figures including an exclusive Horace slughorn,  exclusive luna lovegood, exclusive Hermione granger, exclusive Ronald Weasley ,  exclusive lavender brown, exclusive Harry Potter and a draco Malfoy. 

The first build of the set is a greenhouse witch has 4 mandrakes despite not being as good as the previous one they are not too bad. The roof is movable to allow more play.

Then there are another potions room. I think that it should have been a different room because we have one in the whomping willow, it should have been a libary.

Finally, the actual tower has 5 floors first has a broom and an entrance. The second has Horace Slughorn  office with a lantern and letter the third floor has the Ravenclaw dormitories the fourth floor has the astronomy section and the last flaw has the telescope. One problem with the tower is the white frames. 

There is also a small table with 3 of the uncommon waffle piece. It also includes the new Hedwig.

Over all this set is great and I would recommend it to you especially if you have any other attachments. 

 

By thanosvbest

author: Lego_Photos_X
title: Nice Hogwarts expansion
review:
When i first time saw it I had to buy it. I'm not a big fan of Harry Potter, but I still like the build. Also, I just LOVE Lego Castle, so the build is really nice.

Minifigures: You get total 8 minifigures. First of all you have Harry Potter. It's kinda great looking one, with just one of those classic dark brown hairs. I would say, that the outfit could be better. Then you got Hermione, Ron, Neville, Luna, Lavender, Draco and Gran. I really like some of the designs, but I am not the best one to say, because... I don't really collect Harry Potter too much.

Astronomy Tower: Now to the building itself. I like it a lot, and it's probably the best lego Harry Potter building ever. I have some other Harry Potter sets, but this is the biggest one. Maybe one of the biggest reasons why I bought this set is that it comes out with 2 books which is just really cool. Also, there are some plants in it. + I really love the design of Herbology class, or whatever it is. There are 4 different floors in it. One is the bedroom for ravenclaws, one is for spells (entrance hall/room), one is for the "teacher". The last one is for the actual astronomy. It does have things like telescope. You can also combine this build to other hogwarts sets.

Good Things:

- Nicely detailed astronomy tower with three sections.

- 2 Books. One brown and one green.

- 8 Harry Potter themed minifigures.

- Can combined with other Hogwarts sets.

- Many rooms to put minifigures in them.

Bad things:

- There is nothing really bad about this set. I think it should be more complete from the left side, but that's just alright.

Is it worth it?/My personal opinion

When it comes to question "is it worth it?" i would say it is worth it if you are a Harry Potter fan, but if you buy this set for pieces, minifigures... or anything else, I would say it's not worth the price. I have never regretted buying a Lego set, but this one... Man, I could've just pass it. I really tho like the build & Kinda have learned to like it. Nice shelf piece! (some people might put dislike to this review, "because I don't like HP too much", but I want to say that I still like this particular set much).
